alert.note: Alert for Gadsden; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 1:31PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Gadsden and north central Liberty Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 131 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Greensboro, or 13 miles northeast of Blountstown, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Rock Bluff, Juniper, Sycamore, Hosford, Lowry, Rosedale, Sawdust and Roy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
